lines.text: No more of my men will die in this god forsaken place.
They will if I find them.
Give the puppets Richard Sharpe.
[Perkins is badly wounded]

[sobs]
Sorry, Sarge!
You're gonna be all right, lad.
Dan! Dan! Give me a tune, Dan!

[sings]
O'er the hills, and o'er the main, to Flanders, Portugal and Spain, King George commands and we obey...

[sobs]
Mother!
She's with ya, lad! Mothers never leave you!

[sobbing]
I'm sorry, Sarge...
[he dies]
Oh, my God... Oh, my God... Nobody touches O'Rourke! That bastard's mine!
Perfect! We've sent a regicide to train a palace guard!
O'Rourke! I'll find you, O'Rourke!
[a group of the renegade Irish appear, and Harper blasts them with his volley gun. Only O'Rourke is left standing]
Sergeant Harper... you know I've no quarrel with a fellow Irishman.
[He raises his musket and pulls the trigger. It clicks empty]
A good soldier always looks after his weapon, Private O'Rourke.
[O'Rourke yells and charges with his bayonet. Harper disarms him and spins him around]
O'Rourke, this one's for Perkins...
[stabs him]
This one's for Ireland...
[stabs him again]
And this one's for me!
[stabs him one last time. O'Rourke falls, dead]
[while Loup is holding Lucy as a hostage, he tries to rape her. She smashes a bottle over his head, pushing him away. He brushes glass out of his hair and laughs]
What are you going to do with that, my lady? Kill me?
[She holds the bottle to her own neck]
You will not defile me, sir. On my child's life, you will not.
[Loup pauses, uncertain. He takes a step toward her, and she nicks herself, drawing blood]
I will do it, as God sees me.
[pause]

[sighs]
My men will show you to your quarters.
You have two of my men?
Not for long.
Might I remind you, Major, of the rules of war?
Raping women? Killing babies and young children? What you did here isn't war!
I police these mountains, Major, to protect our supply lines from guerillas. The chief weapon of the guerilla, Major, is horror. Horror! So, I make sure that I am more horrible than my enemy.

[Harper has dragged out the two Frenchmen captured whilst raping women and killing children]
Harper!
Sir!
Put them up against the wall. I want a fireing squad ready.
[In responce, all of the riflemen and members of the South Essex form two lines as the squad]

[after being stabbed by Loup]
You have killed me, sir.
